sentences.english: A physician's sacred duty is to heal the sick.
sentences.chinese: 醫生的神聖職責是救死扶傷。

sentences.english: The protection of the country is the sacred duty of every citizen.
sentences.chinese: 保衛國家是每個公民的神聖職責。

sentences.english: Cancer pain control is sacred duty of doctors, who should make unremitting efforts.
sentences.chinese: 控制癌痛是醫生的神聖職責，需要做出不懈的努力。

sentences.english: It is one that, as President, I consider a moral obligation to uphold.
sentences.chinese: 這是一項，作爲總統，我認爲是我要維護的神聖職責。

sentences.english: Take the ram for the ordination and cook the meat in a sacred place.
sentences.chinese: 你要將承接聖職所獻公羊的肉煮在聖處。

sentences.english: The bishop officiated at the cathedral.
sentences.chinese: 主教在大教堂執行聖職。

sentences.english: You shall take the flesh of the ordination ram and boil it in a holy place.
sentences.chinese: 你要拿授聖職時所獻的公綿羊，在聖處煮它的肉。

sentences.english: I had a godmother who made herself responsible in this way for me.
sentences.chinese: 我也有一個這種肩負神聖職責的教母。

sentences.english: It is your godly duty to care for each other;
sentences.chinese: 這是你們的“神聖職責”，互相關心。

sentences.english: The clergyman has been beneficed in that cathedral.
sentences.chinese: 這位教士被請到該大教堂擔任有俸聖職。

sentences.english: The clergyman has been benefice in that cathedral.
sentences.chinese: 這位教士被請到該大教堂擔任有俸聖職。

sentences.english: We want a priest with clean hands who is worthy of the calling.
sentences.chinese: 們盼望一位配得上上帝的召喚的純淨無暇的聖職者。

definition: to nail securely/to execute by means of impalement/to crucify
